For the families of hostages gathered in Tel Aviv, freedom feels closer than ever: 'I can't help but hope'
subhead: Tens of thousands of people gathered in the Israeli city on Saturday night, determined to believe in the release of the last hostages held in Gaza. Many are also deeply concerned about the rise of pro-Palestinian protests across Europe.
byline: By Isabelle Mandraud (Tel Aviv, special correspondent)

The difficult task of identifying Ukrainian soldiers killed at the front
subhead: The widespread use of drones along the Ukrainian front has left the bodies of soldiers unrecognizable, making the work of already overwhelmed forensic doctors at Dnipro's morgue even more challenging.

title: US federal agent shoots Chicago motorist as protests spread, while a judge blocks troops to Portland
subhead: Illinois Governor JB Pritzker announced the Trump administration's plans to federalize 300 members of the Illinois National Guard, calling the decision 'absolutely outrageous and un-American.' Also on Saturday, US District Judge Karin Immergut blocked Trump's bid to deploy troops into Portland.
byline: Le Monde with AP and AFP

title: Madagascar's President Andry Rajoelina loses the battle for the streets
subhead: The Malagasy president failed on Saturday to rally his supporters to demonstrate their backing after 10 days of protests led by Generation Z.
byline: By Laurence Caramel (Antananarivo (Madagascar), special correspondent) and Guilhem Fabry (Antananarivo (Madagascar), special correspondent)

title: The West Bank village of Palestine's forgotten Americans
subhead: In the occupied West Bank, 85% of Turmus Ayya's population are American-Palestinian citizens. Every summer, these dual nationals return to visit their families and maintain ties with their homeland. They find that their American passports offer no immunity from persecution by the army and settlers in this territory, where illegal Israeli settlements are rapidly expanding.

Le Monde enters Gaza City, an ocean of ruins emptied of its people
subhead: Le Monde's Jerusalem correspondent entered the Palestinian urban area for a few hours on Friday, October 3, under escort from the Israel Defense Forces (IDF). The territory, largely destroyed by airstrikes and bulldozers, was utterly deserted, with nearly all residents having fled south within the enclave.
byline: By Luc Bronner (Gaza City, special correspondent)

title: Hollywood grapples with deep division over Israeli films
subhead: As the antiwar film 'The Sea' is set to represent Israel at the Oscars in 2026, the American film industry is torn apart by petitions and public stances.
byline: By Arnaud Leparmentier (San Francisco (United States) correspondent)

title: Thomas Piketty: 'If Europe does not urgently give up its love of free trade, it risks an unprecedented social and industrial disaster'
subhead: Europe should impose tariffs as a sort of tax on the CO₂ generated by the transportation of goods and to counter the damaging effects of Chinese dumping, writes the French economist.
